meanings.definition: In a way that is sensible and practical
meanings.sent1: She knew she couldn't afford a mansion, so she realistically looked for a cozy apartment.
meanings.sent2: Realistically speaking, it would be better to save money for emergencies rather than spend it all.
meanings.sent3: He tried to fit a giant sofa into his tiny car, but realistically, it was a hilarious sight.
meanings.sent4: Her dream of flying without wings was shattered when she realized it was realistically impossible.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained the concept so realistically that even the youngest students understood.

meanings.definition: In a way that accurately reflects reality
meanings.sent1: The artist painted the landscape realistically, capturing every detail of the scenery.
meanings.sent2: Realistically, it would be best to prepare for the exam by studying in advance.
meanings.sent3: He tried to convince his friends he could juggle ten balls at once, but realistically, it was just a joke.
meanings.sent4: Her words hit him so realistically that he felt like he was living in a different world.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed the historical events so realistically that viewers felt transported back in time.
